content.text: It's more common than you'd think. Even big projects like OpenSSL fall behind the latest standards. The Diffie-Hellman params had been out-of-date for 18 years (!?) before [this PR](https://github.com/openssl/openssl/pull/775). I can't even imagine how much outdated "standards compliant" code exists in proprietary codebases. ðŸ˜± Trying to stay up-to-date on all of the relevant standards is a full-time job.
